thread.title: London Mayor Boris Johnson took out a 10-year-old boy in a rugby game in Japan
thread.title_full: WTF | Watch: London Mayor Boris Johnson took out a 10-year-old boy in a rugby game in Japan - entertainment.ie

author: David O'Shaughnessy
title: London Mayor Boris Johnson took out a 10-year-old boy in a rugby game in Japan
text:
Mayor of London Johnson is on an official trip to Japan and marked the success of the country in England's Rugby World Cup by taking part in a game of street rugby with some children. Unfortunately it didn't go as planned.
Johnson and several schoolchildren were playing on a mini-pitch on the streets of Tokyo when Boris got a little too carried away and bowled over 10-year-old Toki Sekiguchi, who hit the ground hard and "felt a little pain" but said he was "OK" after the hit and was soon playing again.
Boris Johnson facing at least a three week ban for leading with the shoulder against a 10-year-old Japanese boy. pic.twitter.com/uW17GiPU47
â€” Stig Abell (@StigAbell) October 15, 2015 For his part, Boris was straight over to the child to ask if he was OK and shook his hand.
The pair later posed for a photograph as Boris handed over an official 2015 Rugby World Cup ball to the schoolboy to remember him by (because those bruises will fade eventually).
Via The Guardian
